text: A glycoprotein is a big molecule. It is composed of a protein and a carbohydrate (which is usually a sugar-like substance). Glycoproteins are important to recognise immune cells in mammals. Well-known glycoproteins are: * antibodies which react with antigens Hormones that are glycoproteins are (amongst others) * Follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) * Luteinising hormone (LH) * Thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) == Related pages == *Miracle fruit == References == Category:Molecular biology Category:Hormones
title: Glycoprotein
